website_summaries.verdict: A tough, solar-powered watch that offers plenty of basic and specialty functions for navigating the great outdoors.
pros: It has a slew of features including solar power, water resistance, atomic accuracy, altimeter, barometer, thermometer and a compass
Where this watch really shines, though, is through its ability to show sunrise and sunset times
cons: The display is relatively small compared to those of other Casio watches

customer_reviews.title: Great.................for about 1 year........then not so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for just about 1 year and it has been great. I get tons of compliments on how great it looks. However, recently the large numbers in the bottom window have started to fade. The solar battery indicates a full charge, so that can't be the problem. I have worn the watch almost every day for the last year under normal conditions (nothing crazy or extreme). I even take it off before a shower. For a watch that looks super tough............its very disappointing. With this in mind, I would not buy this watch again. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Dean W.

customer_reviews.title: Best digital watch ever
customer_reviews.text: The previous 10 million reviewers who have stated this is the best watch of all-time are absolutely correct. This is a tough, rugged, highly functional, maintenance-free watch that blows everything else out of the water. And at this price point, I have both the black/positive and green/negative versions. Buttons depress with confidence, and despite its size, it is the most comfortable watch in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: johnnyfizz

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch in my cart forever and finally caved. Looks good and fits good on my 7" wrist. The negative display isn't as easy to read as the positive but that should be evident if you have read or watched any reviews. I like the subdued look. It came with a full battery charge and synced up with the atomic clock at 2am the first night. Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Scuzzle Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of use this very expensive watch does not recharge itself. In fact that function stopped working altogether and now the battery indicator stays on Low battery charge. Very expensive watch to last less than a year.. very disappointing because Casio is the only watch I have ever bought and has been my favorite watch for years they are all I buy all I use and have gotten very great results out of all of them except for when I bought an expensive one I thought I was getting a good watch turns out the more money you spend the less you get
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Bad watches...great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 of these and both had the same problem. The first one lasted 3 months and the second less than 48 hours. The problem is the digital display went out and was barely readable. Loved the look and style of the watch but not gambling on a 3rd try. I took photos of each watch for reference. Thankful that Amazon was gracious enough to give a full refund on the 1st watch- great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: David Foote

customer_reviews.title: Horrible decision and lost $200
customer_reviews.text: Feel like I was robbed for $200. Less than a month the watch would lose an hour from time to time (yes the settings where correct and time zone). I figured it was just a fluke. Then exactly a month the watch totally shut down and displayed charging for two days after being out in the sun. I did not get the warranty, was my only mistake, because I thought I was getting a solid watch from a reputal seller. Battery replacement had no effect. I'm disgusted and out of $220. Zero stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ogurkis

customer_reviews.title: The best G-shock
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I own this version as well as the black/positive version. In person the band/case color actually appears more of a tan to me, and not so olive green.
customer_reviews.author: johnnyfizz

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awsome.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a mechanical and automatic watch collector for over 30 years. Never really kept quartz movement watches after first battery died. All of them gifts. This was given to me by my wife for my 60th birthday. We were watching a movie and the main character playing a mercenary was wearing this watch. We found model and watch on amazon. I have had on my wrist for 10 days and i am completely blown away on how bad ass this watch is. So far it has been a amazing time piece. Will update over the next few month’s.
customer_reviews.author: Teebone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tactical use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in 2015, it is now March 2020. It has kept time perfect and all other function have worked when needed. It is a big watch and took a while to get use to it. I am sending it in for repairs. The battery isn't holding a charge. I guess five years and only needs a battery change isn't bad even though it is solar. I got my watch back from Casio. It has a full charge after spending two days in a box. Possibly user error. Even if it had to be repaired I would still recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Clarks

customer_reviews.title: More Functionality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice G Shock. First impression was I was shocked it wasn't larger than my other G Shocks. This goes more than my others, but is pretty much the same size. Same length, maybe 1mm wider. One of my Others has a Bully Bar protector so this one is actually skinnier. All the functions work quite well. Solar powered and atomic clock among other features I did not have before. Very tactical, which I like. But the blacked out/ reversed screen is harder to read though, need to use the light more. But otherwise I really like this watch and many people like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the the adventurous among you!
customer_reviews.text: This is my everyday watch. In my rough and tumble life, I have to have a rugged and reliable watch which gives me both durability and accuracy. This watch gives me both and on top of that I get extras. This is the seventh g shock watch I have owned. Everyone of them has had to endure the harshness of life. I don’t have time for problem watches that can’t hang. This one is built for it. It has solar charging which is great. Built to withstand the elements and persevere! I honestly think you could slap strike it like a hockey puck and it would just say, is that all you got pal?
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Philpot

customer_reviews.title: This Many Reviews Can't Be Wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this G-Shock Rangeman recently based on my experiences with other G-Shock watches and based on the reviews here. There is not much more I can say about this watch that has not been said here. This is an amazing watch with incredible features at a really, really good price. The watch wears incredibly comfortably and is very readable. If you're considering buying this watch, do it. You will not be sorry..... around 1,300 reviews with 4 and 5 stars at 93% can't be wrong....and they are not. I really like this watch and am glad to have it in my collection!
customer_reviews.author: e-shrdlu

customer_reviews.title: Watch does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful watch. I've had nothing but compliments since I've gotten it. Oh... and it's flipping awesome!! Solar power that keeps it going long after Suunto watches have crapped out. Has a compass that is on point. Altimeter. Barometer. Thermometer. The time is updated automatically via radio signals (don't know how, but it does!). I've been wearing G-Shocks forever. They take an absolute beating when I'm on duty and I keep buying them. Keep it up Casio! One thing I wish is that it came in more colors. I'd take one in white, black, and may a silver for special occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Blake D.

customer_reviews.title: The wristwatch is a good Casio product
customer_reviews.text: The wristwatch is a good Casio product. It does all what it says it does and well. The compass is very good and the air pressure measurements are good too. My only gripe with the watch is the negative display. There are several variants of it by Casio and this one is dim and hard to catch at a glance. Other negative displays by Casio worked much better for me. The quality is very good. The only negative is the dimness of the negative display.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Friedman

customer_reviews.title: It supposed to be a g-shock watch, strong, ...
customer_reviews.text: It supposed to be a g-shock watch, strong, durable for any task, after two years there is moisture inside the watch. I'll keep you posted on the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TjTiringo

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Unbreakable, Time Always Correct
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a Great Watch. It keeps perfect time by using radio signals to set the time and you do not have to worry about daylight savings time changes. I own two Rolex and two Tag Hauer watches and find myself always wearing the Rangeman watch for everyday use. The others are used for social events and business settings. I wear this watch while working outdoors, scuba diving, playing sports and training Jack Russels. If these dogs can’t hurt it, believe me, nothing can. I have owned this watch almost four years and am more than completely satisfied. This is not a paid or product inducement review!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tice

customer_reviews.title: The green band was cool, but I don't really like the yellow accents
customer_reviews.text: The green band was cool, but I don't really like the yellow accents. The main issue was the display. Now I LOVE negative display watches and own 2 or 3. However, on this model, the text was some shade of brown, and really dim. It's almost like Casio placed a brown filter over the glass to get that tan, army look to it. Unfortunately, it made this display even harder to read, and I just wasn't a fan of the color choice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Loved this watch so much I gave my old one (bought in 2016) to my Son-in-law and bought me a new one. Some complain about these coming with only medium power. Easy fix. Took 2 hours under my wife's terrarium light she uses to start her vegetables with and it was on full power and has stayed there. Now, I did do this. I wanted a green one but not the negative screen. Bought this one and went on Ebay and got a green band and bezel. Now I have a green one that you can see. :-) Dano
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this watch! I was originally debating on getting this or a Smart Watch and after quite some time I decided to go with this as it's practically bulletproof and won't become obsolete like all other electronics. If your looking for a time tested watch that'll take anything you can throw at it... You found it 🥰
customer_reviews.author: 0m3n

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this watch. My only nitpick is that it’s a bit hard to read in low light conditions however the backlight will solve this. I work at a power plant and use this watch in all areas. It hold out well and the charge is good. I charged once at a windows edge since I got the watch (about 2 months now) and the battery is still at full charge.
customer_reviews.author: asamrx

customer_reviews.title: Defective, stopped working in less than 48 hours. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked for less than 48 hours. Battery would not charge, multiple functions stopped working altogether. Extremely disappointed with the watch, so much so that I have returned it. Will not recommend this watch at all
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Hats

customer_reviews.title: great watch
customer_reviews.text: its going to take you a while to learn all the functions. I even struggled changing time. im not sure if it has summer/winter time auto change. the elevation meter is not going to be acurate if you dont know how to use it. the sensor calibrate the difference to get the height. you have to calibrate it at somewhere you know the exact elevation.
customer_reviews.author: Ruochuan

customer_reviews.title: good item, crummy shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch, easy to set up if you're used to G Shock watches. The manual is a bit daunting, with tiny tiny print, but if you jump in and go it's not bad at all. Wish I could say something good about the UPS shipping. 2 days ( paid extra for 2 Day) ended up being 6 as the brown truck must have taken the scenic route, and the UPS MyChoice didnt honor my choice and left the "Adult Signature REQUIRED" package out in the open in front of everyone. This isnt the first time for them. Didnt have the option to Turn Down Brown at checkout, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO IT.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is spot on. Clasp is crazy comfortable. Buttons are easy to push. Easy to setup and update the time. HOT TIP* when connecting to update time, leave it face down overnight for the first time. Its since updated on it's own whilst I sleep ON MY WRIST! The screen is hard to read in certain light. But I assumed it would be going in. This watch is mantastic. And for the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: The Norriseseses

customer_reviews.title: I own a Casio Pathfinder with the ability to set ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a Casio Pathfinder with the ability to set time automatically and it can charge the internal battery using solar, it has served me well for years but I decided it was time for a new watch; I decided to purchase the GW-9400-1CR because of the positive reviews and it's packed with all the features of the Pathfinder, but what really sold me was the ability to adjust for magnetic declination when using it in compass mode, those folks who use a compass for land navigation will appreciate this feature.
customer_reviews.author: USMCVeteran

customer_reviews.title: Great watch/manual is a bit hard to read
customer_reviews.text: I have had a G-Shock for almost 20 years, and love both my original and this new one. They are hardy, well constructed and in my opinion wonderful. If I had to make any less than adoring comment, it would be the instruction maual is a bit hard to read, as it is compsrativly quite small in physical size but has a lot of informatiom. I found it difficult to read easily, but later found a PDF online and a local watch repair shop who made it easy to set and use
customer_reviews.author: Davepool

customer_reviews.title: Man, I Absolutely Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: First noticed this G-Shock RANGEMAN for myself, man I loved it at first glimpse. All I could think about was popping off the straps and putting adapters and bullbars and being able to put different bands on it. Nice. My nephew was getting his graduate degree, thought it would make a great gift. Turned out he didn't like it and returned it and purchased 2 Invictas and a Bulova. Just thought he would really LOVE THIS RANGEMAN. But I still do. :)
customer_reviews.author: dlbutler922

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I have several watches. This is my digital - work watch. It's water-proof to 600 feet (like anyone is ever that deep anyway), solid-state (no moving parts), and deadly accurate. It adjusts itself each day to match the atomic clock in CO. So it's accurate within a fraction of a second or better, and it does this automatically. Then there are the toys. Altimeter, barometer, thermometer, stop watch, timer, hour chime, world clock, etc. In short, this is the best watch for traveling, working, camping, etc. It's solar too. So no fussing with batteries. There are several versions of the 9400 series. Each one is great. I give it a 10 out of 10!
customer_reviews.author: Honeysuckle Ebstein

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. I don't even know where to start. This is truly an incredible watch. I've trying to decide on what watch to get, and I've looked at all the options of all price ranges. Including smart watches. I finally decided to pull the plug on this guy. I was looking for a watch that'll last, take the abuse, still function and provide full set of features useful for outdoors. I'm confident that this watch will last long enough that I might even be able to pass it on. Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! With flaws
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very very cool it’s got some good weight to it it’s packed full of features for a decent price unfortunately the watch never synced to the atomic time even though I am in a metropolitan area and the band cause my wrist to get very irritated. I definitely tried to wear this watch for a couple days unfortunately for the amount of money I paid it just didn’t seem logical to keep it as it was irritating to wear
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Holtz

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with some minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. Generally I love any watch that I don’t have to wind, set, recharge, or replace batteries. Theses solar G-Shocks with atomic time keeping have my name all over them. This design has one minor flaw though, at least for me. The sensor button that switches from barometer to altimeter, compass etc is just in a horrible place. Just going about my day I end up hitting that button so when I check the time I have to switch back to clock mode. Not a huge issue, just a minor annoyance. Would work a lot better, for me at least, if the sensor button and the light button could swap places. I still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lee J. Eden

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, some design issues
customer_reviews.text: Watch looks great, seems rugged durable however...the black face with bronze numbers is cool looking IF you're under a clear sunny sky. It is difficult to read, the back light doesn't help unless it is VERY dark in the room. The thermometer is always 10 to 40 degrees off if it's ON YOUR WRIST. take it off for 6-7 minutes, then it's good. I keep setting the altitude but after traveling around and returning to where I start...it's wrong again. I really think it's closer to 3 stars but it is so damn tactical...I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Buckskin

customer_reviews.title: Better than mudmaster
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it after watching tonnes of review on YouTube. It serves my purpose of rugged watch. I was skeptical about buying only a digital watch but I am used to it now. I tested the water resistance and it passed. Initially I bought mixmaster gwg 1000 which was more expensive, but mixmaster is too big and also complicated to use. This is just a click watch to go to different mode. I will update more later.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: This is MY watch
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted on it. My old Pro Trek did just about the same thing but there were 3 buttons and they would constantly have the watch in some other mode. This one has a single button and a nice button guard that keeps the watch wherever I want it to be. It has a lot to live up to with the Pro Trek still in service and that watch has had its face smashed into multiple machines without any crystal damage.
customer_reviews.author: D3N1Z3Nx

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. Radio time adjust. Barometer which is great in this area because of summer storms. Thermometer is useless as far as I can tell. Altitude might be useful if I get out of flat country. Very legible display. Solar charging always a plus. Out of the box you may want to charge it fully in sunlight. If you spend a lot of time outdoors don't worry about it. It will get there. I am very happy with this watch. It is a multipurpose tool actually. Stopwatch, Timer, sunrise sunset times. For this to be accurate you have to enter latitude and longitude. Other features I will probably not use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Bought it for my Deployment to Afghanistan and it has worked perfectly. The only thing I don't like about it is that I work in the night, when there is no Sun, so it doesn't charge. The little lights in the rooms are horrible for charging this watch as well, so I have to stick it outside sometimes just to charge it and hope no one steals it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Hill

customer_reviews.title: The watch is really good and tough looking
customer_reviews.text: The watch is really good and tough looking, the two reasons I don't give it a higher score are: 1. The atomic watch sync is not as easy to do as you may hope; you still have a really accurate watch but I choose this one in particular for that feature. Which leads us to number two... 2. For the price you pay and not being able to properly use all the features, I would have rather go with the mudman. Still a really good looking watch, you just have to have in mind that if you live far from any of the sync antenas or in a urban area, you are going to have troubles syncronizing the atomic watch.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo F. Diez

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best watch I've ever owned. Keeps accurate time, and the synchronizing with world time sources is invaluable. The manual describing the watch functions is small but dense, does not lay open, and has small print for my old eyes, and I found it tedious to try and use. Best to refer to the numerous YouTube videos describing setup and functionality. Once the watch is set up for your time zone, latitude and longitude, and altitude it is a marvel of technology. Easy to get thru the functions once you've played with it for a couple hours and become familiar with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this watch.
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a TOUGH wristwatch, and man, did I ever spend the hours researching. No matter what I was looking at, or where I was looking, the answer always pointed to the Casio G-Shock line. Obviously there are things this watch will do that I may never take advantage of, but who knows? The way it keeps it's own accuracy by self-syncing with the atomic clocks is beyond cool. The face is plenty readable, the buttons feel solid, the band very sturdy. I've already bashed it several times at work and it hasn't a mark on it. Glad I finally pulled the trigger and bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Keller

customer_reviews.title: Better in person!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Theres a lot to learn this watch does a lot! There good YouTube vids that walk you threw it. It's way better in person. Pictures don't do it justice . I have small wrist and the size is perfect . I've only had it for a few days. It came on time , the box was smashed but the tin and watch were untouched. All in all I'm glad I made this choice , the best for the price! I will post another review after a few field studies. Planning a couple trips in the superstitions mountains AZ . My home turf , nothing better than hiking into the mountains!
customer_reviews.author: Gainer

customer_reviews.title: Great ABC option
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good ABC watch for kayaking, snorkeling, hiking, ect. After a lot of reading and staring at watches I went and settled on the Rangeman and I couldn't be happier with it. It's simple to use if you're not shy of reading/learning a few things; I think 99% of the very few bad Amazon reviews are folks who have no idea or interest in figuring the watch out (or sometimes even reading its full description). I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a well made, extra tough ABC watch.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to be too big for my wrist. It's not. It looks good. Feels good. I've worn a $30 Walmart Timex for years. But I'll never go back. It's well built. I wasn't sure about the negative display, but I've grown to love it. You can't see it in direct sunlight, but there's ways around that. The alarm isn't as loud as others, but it wakes me up. The barometer and compass are spot on. Haven't used the altimeter much. I love that it's atomic.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Yeahhhh
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch, i am a watch guy and this one was on my list "to get list" didnt dissapoint a bit. Light weight but though (its a G-SHOCK) I wont be using all the gadgets but its great to have and show them off, very pleased
customer_reviews.author: William gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch for Adventures!
customer_reviews.text: Set-up for this watch was very easy and the manual is easy to understand. While this watch is on the pricier end, it comes with many features such as a barometer, solar-charging, compass, and data recall. It's a bulky and somewhat heavy watch to wear if you aren't used to already wearing watches. When solar charging this watch in the direct and hot sun, be careful with how hot the watch's metal gets. The durability and quality of the materials are amazing! Overall, it's a great watch for backpacking, camping, and everyday use!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn-Pinoy

customer_reviews.title: Another great Casio
customer_reviews.text: Another solid Casio. I wanted the green and yellow Rangeman but wanted an everyday watch. I had a Suunto Core that looked awesome but absolute garbage. This watch is everyday but not everyday and go out while not looking like a tactical tool in. The Suunto Core was that watch, minus the fact it didn't work. I wish they made the black Rangeman in black but more blacked out screen and buttons but I can't fault Casio. You know what you're getting with them; a solid and indestructible watch. I haven't played around in the field with the features but so far the basics are great. And no, hand perverts, you can't have a pic of me wearing the watch.
customer_reviews.author: NoChicagono

customer_reviews.title: No Watch Can Beat It!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this watch. The best feature is that the battery never wears down because it is solar charged. The next best feature is that it’s an atomic watch and the time is always accurate. There are improvements over the previous model such as the unbreakable band.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Marson

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic watch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch over 2 years ago and I wear it just about everyday. This is by far the most reliable and tough watch I have ever owned. I have taken it snorkeling in the ocean, skydiving, and on every single one of my outdoor adventures. The altimeter works great, the compass is accurate, and the barometer is perfect for keeping an eye on the weather conditions. I also love the solar powered rechargeable battery. It's just a fantastic all around watch that will not let you down.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Giving it a second chance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch a couple weeks ago. Style great, waterproof yes, solar charging awesome, atomic time keeping sweet, easy to read not so much. The gold on black background is difficult to read at times depending on the lighting. Accuracy nope. Had to reset the Barometer and altitude multiple times and still it’s way off. Altitude actually went negative at one point while climbing. Love the watch looks ,function and features. Returning for a replacement. Hopefully better luck 2nd time around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tough watch you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This watch is totally equipped for ourdoor use. It's got a tough case. Its coffee proof cause I already tipped over a cup of coffee on it and it still works. Keeps flawless time like a cellphone. Temperature, altitude, barometer functions are sharp. It is a solar charged watch but I have had no lack of power due to charge. Battery last a long time. You can buy a charger for it but if your outside in the sun a few hours a day...probably could skip the charger. Otherwise best tough watch I could buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I know because I own one
customer_reviews.text: Great watch and packed with a ton of features. This watch is a do it all and you cant go wrong with it. Casio really nailed it and came out with a tine piece that in some instances could help save your life. The atomic sync makes setting this watch a breeze as well as no maintenance keeping time. I'm a huge fan of the compass as well. Living in Idaho and hunting in the extreme back country helps me keep track of where I am. I personally can justify the asking price because of my life style but all in all this watch is a must.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Watch died. Casio won't fix it.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is garbage. Half the sensors don't work, only the compass is useful. The watch face is hard to read unless the light is on which kills the battery much more quickly. The battery is recharged by "tough solar" which stopped working after about 8 months of use. I was in the field when this watch stopped working on me and Casio doesn't warranty the watch for anything after 1year so I was told to send it in to a repair center for an estimate of a repair I can pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael Petker

customer_reviews.title: He loves the easy buttons for setting his stop watch and the easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband! He has been wearing the g shock watch as long as I can remember. The watches have never stopped working. We only replace them after years of wear and tear. He never takes his watch off so the water proof watch that keeps on going and going and going is a must! He loves the easy buttons for setting his stop watch and the easy access to the lights in the dark. We have always been a huge fan and will continue to always use g shock!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One G To Rule Them All
customer_reviews.text: The Master of G! This is an amazing ABC watch. Altimeter, Barometer, Compass. I've gotten lots of compliments on it since I've started wearing it. The atomic timekeeping is spot on and with the solar recharging it is set it and forget it. Sure beats all my mechanical watches for reliability.
customer_reviews.author: D. LIPPERT

customer_reviews.title: The Casio GW-9400 "Rangeman" is a supremely ruggedwatch that does anything you could want it to do
customer_reviews.text: The Casio GW-9400 "Rangeman" is a supremely rugged watch that does anything you could want it to do. It does all those things that the old ProTrek or Suunto ABC (altimeter, barometer, compass) watches did, but wrapped in a G-shock package. Many refer to this as one of the best G-shocks ever made, and for good reason: it's tough, offers a complete range of capabilities, and is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: PJC

customer_reviews.title: It really is a big bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love everything about it, starting with the colors, has lot of features, solar rechargeable is one of them, very durable, water resistant, dust resistant, impact resistant, compass, barometer, altitude, latitude , worlds clock, it self adjust time
customer_reviews.author: Lou & Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This is a semi-customizable watch in that you need to set Lat/Lon for your area.
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed. This is my 4th G-Shock dating back to the late 90's. The precision and accuracy rivals the handbuilt dress watches I've owned costing $10,000 or more. You have the atomic clock update, solar recharging under any light, and the ABC functions Altimeter, Barometer/Temperature, Compass as well as a multitude of timekeeping features. It is a large rugged watch that is built to withstand everyday outdoor activities. But I would not hesitate to wear it to a formal function. Casio hit it out of the park with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Brown

customer_reviews.title: Really nice piece, I hate to say watch because of ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice piece, I hate to say watch because of all the features. I ordered a black bezel and band from another vendor so I can change the color for the mission. The reverse display is good, and not readily visible to others. A touch of the button lights it up just enough in low light. I'm not worried about smacking it around at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read in the field...small screen
customer_reviews.text: The watch is very good looking and is big, however for such a large bezel watch the actual usable screennis about 3/4 of an inch, and on top of that it has other sub screen information tabs with in that already small screen, making al fonts and.signaling arrows,etc so small that they are really hard to read or use.....is agreat watch but unless you have an more than exelent sight, do not get this watch...not useful in the field because of this... there are orher abc watches that have bigger more readable screens that you can clearly see and rely in any condition...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: Mine was obviously handled a bit before receiving it. Had a light scuff or two and the metal clasp had some odd but small crust in the groove. For a $100 less than the gshock website I would still say this is a stellar product. No condensation inside the display or fogging up. I do swim and shower with it daily (almost). The compass and altimeter seem to work relatively well when I compare to my 5x Garmin. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt van Es

customer_reviews.title: It wears nicely
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in time with all the warranty stuff. It took a few days for battery to High and got me a little worried. The watch looks nice and wears quite small in comparison with other masters of G. Is one of the nicest to wear g shock I have. I'm not going into functions as there are plenty on you tube. Since where I am the atomic sync is not working I can't tell anything about it. However it runs like two seconds a week ahead, so pretty accurate. With this kind of accuracy you don't really need an atomic watch. Anyway, I recommend the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, plenty of features
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved to this watch from the Ironman Triathlon, so my first watch >$50 and it definitely feels larger. Has a lot of features, for being outdoors a lot it does seeom rugged and has held up nicely. No issues with it charging, has always been high charge. Sync was sporadic, it synced 50% of the nights but has really been in time for the most part. The altimeter/thermometer/barometer due need calibrated but remain fairly accurate. The thermometer does even seem to adjust for body temperature, it has remained fairly accurate when worn. Nice watch overall, would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Friend In PA

customer_reviews.title: it gives time and indications from sensor, but i ...
customer_reviews.text: it gives time and indications from sensor, but i never got to update via sat, even im in miami and with an older version of gshock exactly next to it, the older one is updating every night but this new one, not one time updated, i contacted the seller and they told me to reset it, did but still the same, so if you buy it thinking yo will get accurate time everytime, you will not, you will have to check randomly to put it up to date, something that is supposed to be doing but not
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a no frills cheaper G Shock instead - Stay away from Seller US Retail
customer_reviews.text: None of the functions apart from the time work. The thermometer read out 73 degrees F at all times. Altitude readings are based on change in pressure so when the pressure changes due to an approaching storm the watch is going to tell you that your altitude changed! Syncing with the CO radio clock is iffy.. if you force a manual sync it sometimes keeps throwing an ERR message. I got busy with life in general and forgot to contact seller within 30 days of purchase, when contacted on the 31st day, a day after return window closed I got a curt response from US Retail stating that I need to contact Casio. Steer clear of the seller, US Retail.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: My favorite G-Shock.
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite G-Shock to date. It's rugged and has a lot of features. I'm getting up there in years, so I wish the alarm was louder and the numbers were a little bit bigger. I've tried all of the latest models as of this review. The Rangeman is hands down the best bang for your buck you can get. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch!
customer_reviews.text: First off, no batteries are needed because it’s rechargeable via solar power, second there are so many options and features and lastly I am very rough with my watches so buying this watch for just under $200 was well worth it because it is extremely rugged and can take quite a beating. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS WATCH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: My Watch
customer_reviews.text: So this is been My Dream Watch for a few years just I thought this would be so Huge on Me cause I really Love big Rugged Casio Watches but its not as big as I thought, if Casio makes a bigger chunkier watches than this one please let Me know if possible ..... Its still really Cool I Love Casio G Shock watch that's all I ever wear .....Sincerely Ron G.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and price
customer_reviews.text: Has been years since I purchased a Gshock. Started to review all the current models and settled on this one. Great watch, easy to read and very easy operation. Barometer takes time to adjust and get right, if you want to use while wearing the watch. I have a larger wrist band requirements and the stock band just fit. Ordered a 3rd party band and have loved it ever since. $23 band made this a winner for me on all levels.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan St Clair

customer_reviews.title: Solar powered
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. The buttons are big enough for my large fingers. I can read the face screen. I work construction and I am very rough in watches. So far this watch is holding up very well. Just a heads up. I would purchase screen protectors for the watch face. I am glad I have the protectors. I have almost worn out the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: This was a cool watch that looked good too
customer_reviews.text: This was a cool watch that looked good too. However, the altimeter was inaccurate and required constant tuning. The radio synchronization was also a pain, luckily I found a spot that would work on my kitchen windowsill. You might not be so lucky though depending on where you live and what direction your windows face. The deal breaker for me was that the buttons started to making clicking noises which were clearly not supposed to happen. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: cainz

customer_reviews.title: Solid all around performer
customer_reviews.text: My second 9400. Gave the first to my son four or five years ago who still wears it almost every day. Tried several newer alternatives which were either uncomfortable or simply too big. (Come on Casio, shrink down that Gravitymaster to a manageable size!) The 9400 is big, but not too big. Lots of useful features, durable and looks cool without looking goofy. The 9400 is probably the best all around performer in the G Shock line and a bargain at the Amazon sub $200 price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: Good for the functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good for the functionality, but please know that it does basic calculations. If you need extremely precise measurements for temperature, altitude, compass, then you should use a dedicated scientific device designed for the specific purpose. This watch is like a jack of all trades, but master of none if you need general readings only, but not acutely precise for scientific purposes, work roles, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Gshock. Previous one used for 12-13 years but the mode plastic button broken. So I thought it’s time to get a new one. I prefer solar power and 9400 offers more features. It’s metal bottom at first. Radio sync works well. White backlight, equipped 3 sensors. To certain level the sensor does not work as I expected. The temperature reading is your skin temp. I still struggling on altitude reading as the instruction does not present a real example how it works. So except sensor I like it.
customer_reviews.author: H.Zhou

customer_reviews.title: BEST G -SHOCK!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME G Shock!!!! Did a lot of research and eventually made my decision to purchase the Rangeman and I'm not disappointed! Highly recommend. Also, you can swap out the band with JaysAndKays 5600 convertible adapters. However, the stock band is very comfortable. Purchased from Discount Watch Store....good overall experience!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Maintains a high charge with little or no effort. I use the timer often and found it easy to use. I like the fact that it has the date, day, time, daylight savings time, am/pm, and battery charge all visible. This has become my favorite watch and I wear it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Greyflash

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, handy features.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend had been wanting one of these watches for a while now and I was finally able to get him this one and he absolutely loves it, it has far exceeded his expectations. This watch is very well made and very much worth the price. He has a very physically demanding job so it's nice for him to have a watch that he can use while working without the worry of it getting damaged or breaking. The features of it come in handy when he is hunting or hiking in the mountain as well. If you are thinking of buying one, I recommend doing so. You will not be sorry you did.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Tank!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a tank! It looks great, has great functions, good weight, feels good wearing it. Like some of the other views it is kind of hard to read in certain lights. But that is what the light on the watch it for to help you to read it when you need to. Would have gave a 5 star if it was readable in more lights but that is my only complaint. If you want a quality tough good watch at not that bad of a price. Well look no farther and get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Head to Tail BBQ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the watch that ends my watch fetish. Triple sensor and sexy as can be. Fits like a glove and the light is amazing. Functions all work as they are supposed to. Zero complaints and all love.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: best feature:cost ratio out there
customer_reviews.text: From doing a bunch of research, this is probably the best features:cost ratio of most recent G-shocks. I particularly like the sunrise/sunset calendar for my work, and the automatic atomic clock sync is a fantastic feature. Lots of features, relatively simple to operate, and there's a fantastic youtube series where a dedicated fan goes through each and every one. Putting my arm out the window while I drive for 5 minutes is enough to charge the watch for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch and wears actually pretty comfortably
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch and wears actually pretty comfortably. I thought it would wear me down through the day but that’s not the case. The band is soft and the watch is not to heavy compared to many metal bracelet watches out there. I love having a triple sensor Casio again and this being a G shock is even better. Also love the instant stopwatch function which switches to and starts the stopwatch with one push in the time mode. A $300 watch for $180... well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Don Summers

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and handsome
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid watch, I wasn’t used to bulky watches so it was uncomfortable for the first few days. But aside from that, time is accurate and the other functions work good as well, highly recommended ABC watch if you’re in the market for one. Also visually appealing, to me at least.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Item came with damage
customer_reviews.text: This watch came damaged! The metal clasp is scratched from obvious wearing and there appears to be scratching on the face! I will accept an exchange otherwise a refund will do. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: david hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had my eye on this watch for a while and very pleased I got it. I have a g-shock ga-110 and love it. The rangeman has a way better display light than other g-shocks I have.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Coss

customer_reviews.title: Warfighter approved and tested
customer_reviews.text: This watch can do it all. After owning several G-shocks and progressively upgrading each time, I think it's safe to say that this will be my last. I say this in the most positive way possible- this watch has everything I need and more. Not to mention, I receive compliments on it daily. By setting my elevation, the watch automatically accounted for magnetic declination, the solar recharging feature is phenomenal, I absolutely love the negative display, and the watch has already been through testing environments and passed with flying colors. Solid watch, solid company. If you're considering this watch, do yourself a favor- get it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo O.

customer_reviews.title: Best WATCH for under $200!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is legit and the shipping was quick! This is my very first Casio G-Shock and I gotta say I am very impressed to with the quality and design. This is probably the best watch you can buy for less than $200. At first I was a bit worried that it would take me forever to get everything setup but surprisingly setup was easy. I still do recommend going through the manual thoroughly though as there is quite alot to learn about this watch. This seller is legit! I will definitely be picking up the Gulfmaster through them if its in stock.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lo

customer_reviews.title: Master of G Shocks.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered the green version. Love the looks of negative display. It's not that I couldn't read it at all. But I went for function over fashion. This thing is a beast. Barometric pressure has always been on point. I abuse this thing every day and it cleans up so well and is very resistant to scratches. Thermometer is so so. Altimeter works but needs adjusted occasionally. Did a drive up to Alpine visitor center in Colorado at 12,000'. It was dead on. Won't go anywhere without this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin G.

customer_reviews.title: This was one of the better deals I found online
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the better deals I found online, no other seller seemed to offer such a great price for prime members. The product was as described, and so far the quality seems top notch. It has only been one week however, although I don't see any indication anything will go wrong based on the quality. All factory paperwork was included, the only thing I will mention as other reviewers have, the G-Shock cardboard box was in rough shape upon arrival, however this is no big deal since the actual watch case is a metal can.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a G-Shock for a few years, finally decided to do it. I wanted one with a compass, this includes altimeter and barometer/thermometer. I really like the nightly atomic clock updates that occur automatically, never need to set my watch (in U.S.). The Tough Solar feature seems very cool, curious to see hoiw long it lasts. Finally, while a bigger watch and I have average wrist, it is very comfortable (lightweight) to wear and exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick John Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gear!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch! This thing does everything except launch the space shuttle. Like others have said it is hard to read the display but with the auto light there’s no problem. I expected to be annoyed with it. I’m very picky. But doesn’t bother me at all. The pure functionality makes it worth it. I have been a G-Shock fan since basic. I have owned several. This watch is no different. Exceeds expectations, doesn’t disappoint. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K9Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a great tool for the outdoors, lots of capabilities and very useful with all the integrated sensors. Be sure to calibrate the Compass and Altimeter for more accurate readings. The temperature will not read correct outside temperature if you wear the watch on your wrist. Conclusion: This isn't a calibrated set of sensors per se, however this watch is still a great source of reference data and multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rickey

customer_reviews.title: Best Casio G Shock 👍😍🤩
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Casio G Shock RangeMan Watch. Got it as a Father's Day Gift. It came as described, Brand New in it's original packaging. Original price is estimated at $300. US Dollars. So happy to get it on sale. Tough Solar, with Triple Sensor , built in digital Compass.....it's Amazing....Highly recommend for all G Shock Fans.....
customer_reviews.author: JAX

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Easy access timer, great display, easy to use. Ive had it for a little over a week and am happier and happier with my decision. If you're a woman looking into getting this watch, don't be daunted by the size of the bezel. I am 5'8" and my forearm is about 4-5" wide and isn't swallowed by the watch. Very happy, very useful!
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to decide, I can tell you that I am not a G-shock watch fan. But I love this one. The functions are excellent, working the watch is relatively easy (although not necessarily intuitive), and despite its size, the watch is very comfortable. I paid $176. Not sure I would pay more, but it's a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: scott beal

customer_reviews.title: Great rugged watch, hard to read ABC data on display though.
customer_reviews.text: It's chunky, even vulgar, but you gotta love it. The only criticism is related to the display. Regardless of what I thought before I bought the watch, it is really hard to see the display in daylight. I don't have reading glasses or near sightedness issues btw. If you're a fan of the ABC concept, and maybe even a Protrek owner, you will be disappointed by the display. It's impossible to use the barometric differential, three compass is also really hard to see, let alone use.
customer_reviews.author: Morné Botha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch, features worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The watch works great, looks good. Thumbs up. I gave four stars ,not because of the watch, but because the print in thew Users Guide is so small I couldn't read it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: I like G Shock
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch. I had this for almost two years, has a built in solar charger for the watch battery which is interesting. The only thing I don't like is the mercury switch that turns on the light when Im sleeping. Even if I turn it off it somehow manages to get reactivated. I only had the battery almost die once, but that was close to when I first got it. other than that, it is a very nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It is large so you should be aware of that before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: This was a graduation gift for our soldier and has as he says “a $&:/ ton of features”. It is large as most of these are but once he got used to it he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Gimlet

customer_reviews.title: Right size and practical
customer_reviews.text: Good and logical menu system. The size is not too small nor too big like a monster, just right. This style can last for decades. I have done hours of research and finally get this one.
customer_reviews.author: autohk

customer_reviews.title: The watch is great but the band is less great
customer_reviews.text: We have had this watch for three years now, the watch itself is great. We have had to replace the band on it twice. It is not the band itself that breaks but the components that hold the band in place, the small pieces. I cannot find a way to replace those parts.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie and Yvonne Meza

customer_reviews.title: My 1st digital watch :)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch. The best G-Shock you can own in my opinion with its triple sensor, you cant deniably go wrong with this watch. The tempature/thermometer setting I had to calibrate it 10-15 degrees lower to get an exact temp reading while wearing the watch. I've had it for a week now and been wearing it everyday other than my analog jewelry watches. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible watch. Attention to detail. Great function. Easy to set up. Atomic time is simply great,never having to reset time. Spot on. Solar charged. Barometer function superb. Digital compass excellent. Altimeter works good. Rest functions beyond expections. When wearing and using, you become aware soon this operates like no inexpensive timepiece. Very trick. Recommend, highly.
customer_reviews.author: FIXED GEAR FL.

product_meta.title: G-Shock Rangeman GW-9400
product_meta.description:
Born from a dream of "creating a watch that never breaks." It was over 30 years ago, a CASIO engineer won the battle against the laws of nature. He designed a watch that would resist centrifugal and impact forces, as well as high water pressure. Since then, the name G-SHOCK has become a byword for independence and pushing the limits. G-SHOCK watches are the most durable digital and analog-digital watches in the industry, trusted by military personnel, law enforcement, surfers and outdoor enthusiasts around the world. Along with this, G-SHOCK is highly touted in the fashion world, worn by icons in hip-hop, sports, and design. With limited edition collaborations being released often, you can always find a G-SHOCK that matches your personality and style.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :1 x 1 x 1 inches; 11.11 Ounces
 * Item model number :GW9400-1CR
 * Department :Mens
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :November 1, 2013
 * Manufacturer :Casio
 * ASIN :B00GFYYKLA

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #17,531 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #122 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #8729 inMen's Shops 
    *  #25 inMen's Sport Watches 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.7 out of 5 stars3,332 ratings Born from a dream of "creating a watch that never breaks." It was over 30 years ago, a CASIO engineer won the battle against the laws of nature. He designed a watch that would resist centrifugal and impact forces, as well as high water pressure. Since then, the name G-SHOCK has become a byword for independence and pushing the limits. G-SHOCK watches are the most durable digital and analog-digital watches in the industry, trusted by military personnel, law enforcement, surfers and outdoor enthusiasts around the world. Along with this, G-SHOCK is highly touted in the fashion world, worn by icons in hip-hop, sports, and design. With limited edition collaborations being released often, you can always find a G-SHOCK that matches your personality and style.
feature_bullets: Solar-powered digital watch in stainless steel with multiple displays, red contrasts, and textured pushers

Features digital compass, altimeter, barometer, thermometer, sunrise and sunset date, time stamp, Mb6 atomic timekeeping, auto LED, 5 Daily Alarms (4 one-time and 1 snooze alarm), 1/10-second stop watch, countdown timer, day/date/month calendar, and buckle closure
Water resistant to 660 feet (200 M): suitable for recreational scuba diving
